title: CHINA LAND CLAIMS
text: China is involved in several territorial disputes with its neighbors, both on land and at sea. In the South China Sea, China claims nearly the entire area through the nine-dash line, leading to disputes with countries like Vietnam, the Philippines, and Malaysia. The East China Sea features a dispute with Japan over the Senkaku/Diaoyu Islands, which are strategically important and potentially resource-rich. On land, China and India have ongoing disputes over regions such as Arunachal Pradesh and Aksai Chin, contributing to periodic tensions along their shared Himalayan border. Additionally, China claims Taiwan as a province, despite the island operating as a separate political entity. These disputes are complex and involve historical claims, strategic interests, and regional security concerns
blurb: China claimed the South China sea, Taiwan, as well as Tibetan lands that conflict with the official maps of the UN.
